result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:54 AM Defendant Steven D Isnard in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant would like the Court to appoint counsel.  Court provides the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court takes recess at 10:55 am.  Matter recalled at 11:01 am with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court denies the request.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
